answers.answer: Sounds like you are having a thorough evaluation -- would wait to see how things turn out.  The cytomel may not be the best option - or at least consider use at a relatively low dose 2.5-5mcg 2x/day.
well so far all labs appear to be normal except tsh

question: In Feb 2009 I was diagnosed by Dr. hypothyroid started cytomel after 2 months rechecked labs added synthroid.  TSH was <0.1.  2 months later still no change--no med change.  Went to Endocronologist and she ordered numerous labs.  Thinks may be pituitary tumor.  Symptoms are weight gain without being able to loose any, night sweats--recent hysterectomy, cold intolerance only during daytime.  Occasional hair loss --not bad.  Carpal tunnel--use computer allday, hand tingles when I have to start an IV or draw blood on someone.  Painful intercourse at times thought due to hysterectomy but was told by GYN should be healed fine since it has been 1 year since surgery.  Very moody one second I am fine the next I am ready bite, sinus problems which I have had for years, high insulin levels--had gestational diabetes with both pregnancies.  Was infertile and had to due IVF due to PCOS ( never had periods usually took progesterone 1-2 yearly to induce period, and also I do not produce Progesterone, was on progesterone compounded to maintain pregnancies for first trimester.  ALso high testosterone levels.  Haven't heard back on the recent testing which is cmp, acth, cortisol, IGF-1, prolactin, tsh, fsh, free and total testosterone, androstenedion, hydroxyprogesterone, dhea sulfate, 24 hour urine free cortisol.  Would like MRI but hasn't been ordered yet.
title: hypothyroid?
